We won this session, but the fight goes on.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

We didn’t get everything we wanted from the 2019 Legislature, but we got a lot done thanks to our members and supporters who called their representatives, sent them emails, testified at hearings, and advocated to protect and expand civil rights and liberties for all Nevadans.

We’re currently compiling our legislative report and scorecard, but we wanted to take a moment right now to celebrate and say thank you!

Here are just a few of the victories you helped achieve:

  • AB449: Calls for a study regarding Nevada youth who are being housed at adult jails and prisons.
  • AB183: Bans the use of private prisons by the state of Nevada.
  • AB236: Arguably the most ambitious criminal justice reform of the session, this bill expands access to diversion and rehabilitation programs and fixes sentencing disparities for lower level drug and property crimes.
  • AB192: This bill will seal records of past marijuana convictions.
  • SB179: The Trust Nevada Women Act decriminalizes abortion and cleans up antiquated statutes related to reproductive freedoms.
  • SB287: Updates our public records law, adding badly needed accountability and responsiveness measures for agencies that flout the law.
  • AB345: Implements Automatic Voter Registration, same-day voter registration, and expands the early voting period and access to absentee ballots.
  • AB431: Streamlines the process for restoring voting rights to people who have been convicted of certain crimes.

None of this would have been possible without our policy team, Holly Welborn, Rex Reed, and Lu Ann Pillar, and Wesley Juhl, our communications manager. The work they did this session was amazing, and these victories would not have been possible without their hard work and dedication.

Of course, this session had its disappointments as well. Those of us who do this work—and those of you who fight alongside us—know that the battle for civil rights never really ends, and that is why we persist in perfecting our union.

Working together we can achieve more victories in the interim and in the next session. Thank you for all that you do for Nevada.

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter for the latest updates on civil rights and liberties.

Thanks for sticking with us,

Tod Story
Executive Director, ACLU of Nevada
